conclusion: Use properties of ideal gas and equation PV = nRT
Given temperature in state C is 300 K, find temperature in state B
State A: P_A = 3x10^5 Pa, V_A = 5x10^-3 m^3
State B: P_B = 2x10^5 Pa, V_B = 5x10^-3 m^3
State C: P_C = 5x10^5 Pa, V_C = 2x10^-3 m^3
Temperature same for states A and B, use P_1 V_1 = P_2 V_2 for isothermal process
Use relationship P_A V_A / T_A = P_B V_B / T_B = P_C V_C / T_C
Use P_A V_A / T_A = P_C V_C / T_C to find T_B
Process from A to B not isothermal, use constant PV product along path
Find T_B using T_B = (P_B V_B / P_A V_A) T_A
Use T_B = (P_B V_B / P_C V_C) T_C to find temperature in state B
Substitute values: T_B = (2x10^5 x 5x10^-3) / (5x10^5 x 2x10^-3) x 300
Correct approach: T_B = (P_B V_B / P_C V_C) T_C
Substitute values again: T_B = (2x10^5 x 5x10^-3) / (5x10^5 x 2x10^-3) x 300
